answers.answer: Hi,Pain along with numbness and tingling in the back may be due to spinal nerve compression in the back. There could be an associated Peripheral neuropathy due to vitamin deficiency, shingles, toxic nerve damage, diabetes, nerve injury or other causes leading to the leg pain.  I think you have had a CT scan of the head. Please go for MRI of the spine and legs and consult a neurologist for diagnosis and treatment. Hope this helps you. Take care and regards!

question: I posted a couple days ago with headaches, achy neck and back and tingling/numbness in back.  I woke up in the middle of the night last night-screaming.  I had tearing, stabbing pains in my upper right leg.  The pain was so severe I was up out of bed and screaming before I even knew what I was doing.  I woke my sleeping daughter.  The pain subsided within a few minutes and now just kind of aches, but hurts nowhere near as bad.  My other leg also is achy, almost like flu type body aches.  I had a CT scan and xray of neck and back last night and still waiting to hear form my Dr.  Any thoughts??Thanks.
title: New symptom...sharp, stabbing tearing pain
